A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: I rated The Last Jedi exactly in the middle because this movie is exactly in the middle of good and bad. Really\, it’s incredibly mediocre. A great movie for 9 year olds. But anyone who has ever read a great story book\, seen a great movie\, watched a great television drama\, or experienced any other form of great storytelling is going to feel let down. Some of the scenes are incredible. Some of the developments are amazing. But others are totally flat\, with no real attempt to bring them to life. Take Kylo Ren; his character is wonderfully more nuanced and layered in The Last Jedi as opposed to The Force Awakens. You feel the conflict within him\, and it is immensely compelling. Contrast that with Rey; her character is wasted\, right down to her anticlimactic parentage (if that was even true or not\, I can’t tell). She starts out the movie delivering the canned script of a telemarketer\, asking Luke to come back with her\, he’s their only hope\, blah blah blah\, and her canned lines and character only plateaus from that underwhelming introduction. We don’t know why she is so connected to the Force. We don’t know why she is connected to Luke or Ren. We don’t know why any of this matters to her\, or why she matters to the Galaxy or the story. Only that she’s a great Jedi. Yay? Furthermore\, Poe’s character is utterly wasted. Finn’s character is utterly wasted. Even time honored characters like Leia\, C-3PO or R2-D2 are wasted. It’s almost like they are needless baggage along for a meandering ride to nowhere. All of Poe’s plot is fruitless and pointless in the end. Finn’s story could be cut from the whole movie\, and you’d never notice it was gone. Leia was in a coma for most of the movie\, and that pretty much describes how compelling her story was. 3PO and R2 aren’t comic relief\, just annoying add-ins that have to be there\, because\, um\, tradition? But then\, we have Luke’s character. Interesting motivation\, philosophical dilemma\, personal soul-searching\, troubled by mistakes and regrets\, Luke is developed well\, right to the end battle with Ren. But\, yet again\, Snoke’s character. We start out not knowing who he is\, what his motives are\, where he comes from\, why he’s so powerful\, how did he come to control the shattered Empire...and then\, he dies. Um\, really? Wait\, is he going to Force-resurrect? Anytime here? Um\, wait\, what just happened?!?! I feel like this movie had a great plot that was merged with no plot at all\, and hence there is a hybrid of good and terrible. And it’s horribly unbalanced\, not at all like the balance of the Light and the Dark. It just comes across as really confusing and jumbled\, and you leave the movie with more disappointment than satisfaction.
